# Special-Use Numeric Types

**API Collection**

Work with fixed-width numeric types of different sizes.

## Unsigned Integers

- **UInt**: An unsigned integer value type.
- **UInt8**: An 8-bit unsigned integer value type.
- **UInt16**: A 16-bit unsigned integer value type.
- **UInt32**: A 32-bit unsigned integer value type.
- **UInt64**: A 64-bit unsigned integer value type.
- **UInt128**: A 128-bit unsigned integer value type.

## Signed Integers

- **Int8**: An 8-bit signed integer value type.
- **Int16**: A 16-bit signed integer value type.
- **Int32**: A 32-bit signed integer value type.
- **Int64**: A 64-bit signed integer value type.
- **Int128**: A 128-bit signed integer value type.

## Casting Between Integer Types

- **numericCast(_:)**: Returns the given integer as the equivalent value in a different integer type.

## Floating-Point Values

- **Float16**: A half-precision (16b), floating-point value type.
- **Float80**: An extended-precision, floating-point value type.

## Floating-Point Type Aliases

- **Float32**: A 32-bit floating point type.
- **Float64**: A 64-bit floating point type.

## Advanced Numerics

- **Numeric Protocols**: Write generic code that works with any numeric type.
- **SIMD Vector Types**: Work with fixed-width vectors of fixed-width numeric types of different sizes.
- **Global Numeric Functions**: Use these functions with numeric values and other comparable types.
